ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] SS Arms vs Sleeve of the Ancient
ygData.msgSnippet: It really depends on your bard.  are you hurting for strength?  the 6ac by itself is really negligible and you won t notice the difference.  that dar knight in
ygData.messageBody:
It really depends on your bard. are you hurting for strength? the 6ac by itself
is really negligible and you won't notice the difference. that dar knight in sebilis
won't all of a sudden start hitting you for 90 instead of 110, for example, heh.
but the singing steel will weigh more, so if you have a low base strength, you may
not be able to go full singing steel. i put all my spare points in the beginning into
strength because i knew in the teens/20's i'd need it for bronze armor. lambent and
imbrued isn't too heavy, but then singing steel is pretty weighty again. so it worked
out pretty good. i've got full singing steel except for hero bracer and ebbp and i run
into weight problems every now and then even with an abukar box.

on the other hand, 2k is just plat, and easily replaceable. just go farm unrest
or cazic or lower guk for fine steel weapons.

At 09:40 AM 1/22/01 -1000, you wrote:
>I currently have SotA but someone offered to sell me SS arms for 2K over the
>weekend. The AC for the SS is 6 better than SotA, but the SotA provide STR
>and CHR bonuses while the SS has no stat bonuses. I have been waiting until
>I dinged 50 before I started to hunt in Sebilis. Well I dinged 50 this
>weekend so plan to start going there soon. Now I have heard that SS arms
>are not that hard to acquire in Seb. So I am debating if I should buy the
>SS arms now or wait until I can loot them for myself. The 2K will clean me
>out so would prefer to loot them instead of buying them. But if they are
>harder to acquire than what I was told, then I may decide to fork out the
>cash. For those of you with a lot of experience fighting in Seb, would like
>to hear what you have to say.
>
>Thanks
>Galtin of E'ci
>
>
>[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>
>
>Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to lol@... with the subject submissions.
